item.title: Public Schools fight back?
item.description: Disclaimer: This article is the opinion of the author and does not necessarily reflect that of all Teachers' Christian Fellowship members. Public Schools fight back? In recent weeks (July 2018), there has been considerable ideological debate about whether public schools should continue to support selective schools. This is partly a debate about whether public schools should be local and comprehensive or cater for specialist needs including intellectual superiority. In an education textbook, the debate would be along traditional lines, but today’s arguments have a social context, with historical and political heritages, that are affected by the current makeup of the Australian population, social expectations about schools and, of course, funding.
